ada-hub command¶

usage: ada-hub [-h] [-v | -d | -q | -s] [-D DATA_DIR] [-C CONFIG_DIR] {credits,cli,gui} ...

Named Arguments¶

-v, --verbose

Instruct the logger to output all messages below debug level to the console

Default: False

-d, --debug

Instruct the logger to output all messages it has to the console

Default: False

-q, --quiet

Instruct the logger to suppress all logger messages below WARNING level from being output to the console

Default: False

-s, --silent

Instruct the logger to suppress all logger messages from being output to the console unless they are describing a fatal exception.

Default: False

-D, --data-dir

Provide the filesystem-location of your application’s data directory, or the destination you want the program to create a data-directory in.

-C, --config-dir

Provide the filesystem-location of your application’s configuration directory, or the destination you want the program to create a configuration directory in.

Sub-Commands¶

Valid sub-commands for ada-hub

command

Possible choices: credits, cli, gui

Sub-commands:¶

credits¶

Print out the credits for all external services/software used to make Ada Hub

ada-hub credits [-h] [-c]

Named Arguments¶

-c, --clear-screen

Clear the terminal before printing the credits

Default: False

cli¶

Run a quick query using the command line (no GUI)

Run the program in command-line mode. This is useful if you’re running a headless set-up

See cli command

gui

Run the program in Graphical User Interface mode

See gui command

credits

Show the credits for the application. This includes developers, API providers, and credit to artists who helped make icons, pictures, etc

See credits command

ada-hub cli [-h] [-l LOCATION]

Named Arguments¶

-l, --location

gui¶

Start the program with the full GUI

ada-hub gui [-h] [-e EMULATOR] {list-themes} ...

Named Arguments¶

-e, --emulator

Start the Ada Hub application with the Sense-Emu backend.

Default: False

GUI Specific Commands¶

gui_command

Possible choices: list-themes

Sub-commands specific to information or manipulation of the Graphical User Interface?

Sub-commands:¶

list-themes¶

Print out a list of strings that contain a list of acceptable theme names, and then quits. (Useful for if you want to specify a theme in your program-opening commands

ada-hub gui list-themes [-h]
